definitions: To take a poll of; to question (a person, group, or area) in a poll.
To receive or record (a certain number of votes).
To cut off or shave the hair, wool, or horns of.
To register (a certain number of votes).
examples: The candidate polls well in rural areas.
The survey polls public opinion on the new policy.
The party polls a significant percentage of the vote.
The election polls show a close race.
